Reviews.Title: great phone.
Reviews.Author: K. C. "belongamik"
Reviews.Content: I already had this as my personal cell, but bought another for my second. It is a great phone. But if you drop it the whole thing comes apart including the battery. And the picture snaps -not great quality but I have down loaded many from my phone card.

Reviews.Title: Good qwerty feature phone
Reviews.Author: Joey Joe Joe Jr. Shabadoo
Reviews.Content: If what you want from a phone is a basic "feature" phone (i.e., not smart), and you want a qwerty keyboard to do your texting on, this is a great phone. It's not much more than what I described, but it is certainly not less than what I described. I had one of these for about two years and loved it. Then I got one for my mom when her phone broke, and she loved it. Again, it's not a smartphone, which may be a feature for you. This phone worked right away when I put the SIM card in from my mom's old phone. If you don't have a SIM card in your current phone, though, this phone will not work for you. You'll need to change providers.

Reviews.Title: unlocked gsm phone
Reviews.Author: vicki belcher
Reviews.Content: well i bought 2, 1 was good an attt phone as advertised. the other 1 was a piece of junk. it was not an att phone, the network provider was some funky woo-doo.com. it was not able to connect to internet to down load apps. i sent it back

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy This Phone
Reviews.Author: BillWill
Reviews.Content: The Samsung Evergreen may spend most of its time hung up while "initializing" the contacts. Samsung says the problem doesn't exist. The Internet disagrees. I am using my phone as a paper weight now.
